items

Class Item

  • java.lang.Object
    • items.Item

  • public class Item
extends java.lang.Object
    Item is the representation of one Item used by the player.

    An Item is represented by its name, its Image, the characters it provides to the player, and its stat. An Item can be one of two types: a weapon or a shield. The stat can be one of: damage or defence. Each type represents a stat respectively.

    Item also contains everything required to provide the player with Items, and make sure that the player doesn't get duplicates.

    Changes: The class now supports updated specifications for type and proper rendering.

    Total Time Spent: 2 hour(s).

    Version:
    2.0.0.0
    Author:
    Lev Raizman

      The picture representation of the Item.
      private int gemSlotType
      -1 if the Item subtracts the value of the Gem, +1 if it adds it.
      private static char[] letters
      All the letters needed to complete the game.
      protected java.lang.String name
      The name of the Item.
      private int stat
      The value of the stat provided by this Item which corresponds to the Items type.
      private java.lang.Boolean weapon
      True if this is a weapon, false if it is a shield, null if it is neither.

      • charsAvail

        private int[] charsAvail
        The characters this Item provides to the player in combat. Each position in the array corresponds to a respective character, starting from 'A'.

        The value of the stat provided by this Item which corresponds to the Items type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Item

        public Item(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.Boolean type,
            int statVal,
            java.lang.String description,
            int[] charsAvail,
            int gemType)
        Creates an Item by taking everything that the Item needs.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the Item.
        type - type of the Item as specified by weapon.
        statVal - the strength of the Item.
        description - the description of the Item.
        charsAvail - the characters provided by this Item.
        gemType - the type of slot the weapon has, as specified by gemSlotType.

        public void setCharAvail(int pos,
                         int value)
        Change the amount of a character at a specific position provided. Position is used as defined in charsAvail.
        Parameters:
        pos - Position in the charsAvail array.
        value - New value at the position.

      • initLetters

        private static char[] initLetters()
        Initializes an array with all the letters required, and randomizes it.
        Returns:
        An array containing all letters of the sentence "LAUGHTER BY WORD", in a random order.

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Reinitializes all static fields.

      • getItem

        public static Item getItem(int level)
        Returns a random Item from the level, and removes it.
        Parameters:
        level - the level from which the Item is needed.
        Returns:
        The Item chosen.

      • itemsLeft

        public static int itemsLeft(int level)
        The amount of unused Items on this level.
        Parameters:
        level - the level for which remaining Items should be checked.
        Returns:
        The amount of unused Items on this level.

      • initAllItems

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Item>[] initAllItems()
        Initializes all Items available in the game.
        Returns:
        All Items available in the game as an array of ArrayList, where a given ArrayList is at the specified level position.
